name: deimosrising
text: The hash browns thing seems useful really

name: spectre
text: Of all the subjects Roast Beef wrote about in RECIPES FOR A LADY OR A MAN: THE ACHEWOOD COOKBOOK, home fries seems to invoke the greatest passion. ("Once you make a potato chewy, you are doing things to it so wrong that it would be best if you just gave that person the potato, and let them take it home and try to make sense of it by themself.")

name: idsyen
text: Such truth! If only more restaurants understood.

name: theloneliestmonkey
text: Of course Ray the software entrepreneur wears a tie and a phone headset.

name: mr_pete
text:
Step 1: Write buggy beta software.
Steps 2-4: See above
Step 5: Pick out Herman Miller chairs.

name: quinlaenar
text:
Step 6: ???
Step 7: PROFIT!

name: overmedicated
text: I'm going to chubby you for sheer ballsyness there.

name: anomalous3
text: This would actually be very useful for people who never throw away their eggs or milk until they've used them all up even when they're expired. (Everytime I see my mom or dad I refuse to eat anything dairy-based. They may think I'm a vegan. I let them. There's eggs in there that have been there since 04)

name: tekende
text: I have noticed that eggs often seem to last past the expiration date, while milk does not.

name: boredom_man
text: Also if you drink directly out of a milk carton it causes the remaining milk to expire faster, but if you drink a portion of an egg and leave a remaining portion it does something else.

name: flynn
text: This is a casual story arc suitable for any occasion.

name: hellofyellin
text: Such as a simple thing of friends, like a barbeque.

name: dunkus-bolunkus
text: Devilled eggs, man. Devilled goddamn eggs. Not good with hash browns, but a must for potluck dinners

name: overmedicated
text: If Achewood ever went animated, this would be the first episode. This I assure you.

name: petro
text: The software is only vaild if one never runs out of milk or eggs. Is this bad coding or a très post-modern joke that I am not cool enought to get?

name: spectre
text: Alt text: "mummbl mumble mrrmumble"

name: aperson
text: Let's make this clear - Ray is not writing anything down with that pen.

name: jhunter
text: he's drawing a picture of a naked lady. it's on a birthday card featuring a pink cake, and her buttocks are hovering precariously -- teasingly -- over it.

name: evolume
text: i need a program that will calculate how much spaghetti to boil.

name: plezure
text: Ray's light bulb is really big.

name: joeyramoney
text: ray's mouth is peekin' open a little bit for the first time, like it's just sticking it's toe in the water a little.

name: anitrophaeron
text: Beef seems really sad with himself for writing a hash brown function.

name: kleptonis
text: Unfortunately Beef made one miscalculation with his hash brown function. You can never have enough hash browns.

name: rowboat
text: People! I don't usually badger about things such as Beef ratings, but this strip is kind of really epic in very many small ways. It lays hell of groundwork for so many subtle elements that will appear again and again and be wonderful. It may not be the funniest, but it may be the most important. Let's come proper. Let's make this a 5, folks.

name: coco
text: Ray's idea is so huge and awesome that he is actually in pain.

name: steerpike66
text: It's the magnificence of the conception trying to smash its way out of his little cat head.

name: tttt2
text: Ray is so unnecessarily accusatory

name: farqussus
text: Ray is of a mind that programming computers is something Roast Beef should not be doing. He does not understand them.

name: wallabeechamp
text: OMG! Ray using Roast Beef's autism to be successful! It's started!

name: greenkoolayd
text: roast beef isnt autistic.  you must be out of your mind.

name: syrupykeyboard
text:
I have eggs. I have milk. But I have no hash browns.
"This is a bittersweet moment," Syrupykeyboard thinks to himself as he fries his eggs.
